channel.title: Channel 9
channel.itunes:summary: Channel 9 keeps you up to date with the latest news and behind the scenes info from Microsoft that developers love to keep up with. From LINQ to SilverLight – Watch videos and hear about all the cool technologies coming and the people behind them.
channel.itunes:author: Microsoft
channel.description: Channel 9 keeps you up to date with the latest news and behind the scenes info from Microsoft that developers love to keep up with. From LINQ to SilverLight – Watch videos and hear about all the cool technologies coming and the people behind them.

item.title: Episode 83 - Windows Azure June 2012 Release | Cloud Cover
item.description:
Join Nate and Nick each week as they cover Windows Azure. You can follow and interact with the show at @CloudCoverShow.
 

In this episode Nathan Totten, Nick Harris, and Michael Washam introduce the newest features of the Windows Azure. Michael shows off the new portal and gives a demo of Windows Azure Virtual Machines and the new PowerShell Cmdlets. Nathan demos Windows Azure Web Sites and the CLI tools for OS X. And finally, Nick shows Windows Azure SDK 1.7 and the tools for Visual Studio 2012 as well as some updates with Windows Azure Cloud Services. This is a longer than normal episode, but it contains all kinds of exciting content.

If you want to skip to specific content you can find what you are looking for at the following times:

  • New Portal: 00:01:20
  • Windows Azure Virtual Machines: 00:09:00
  • PowerShell Cmdlets: 00:27:45
  • Windows Azure Web Sites: 00:36:42
  • OS X Command Line Tools: 00:57:36
  • Windows Azure SDK 1.7 and Visual Studio Tools: 01:07:40
  • Tip of the Week: 01:23:40

 

 In the News:

 

 

Learn Windows Azure. Watch LIVE online on Monday, June 11th as we broadcast from TechEd 2012 in Orlando. LEARN how to use the latest Windows Azure features and services to build, deploy, and manage applications in the cloud with sessions delivered by Microsoft technical leaders Scott Guthrie, Mark Russinovich, Quentin Clark, and Bill Staples! Join us in person at TechEd or register to watch online.

Windows Azure DevCamps. Windows Azure Developer Camps are free, fun, no-fluff events for developers, by developers.  You learn from experts in a low-key, interactive way and then get hands-on time to apply what you've learned. Register for an event close to you today!

Build the next great app at AngelHack – learn more on the Windows Azure blog.  Prizes include $25,000 in seed capital and free Windows Azure for 12 months. 

 

Follow @CloudCoverShow
Follow @cloudnick
Follow @ntotten
Follow @mwashamms

item.title: TWC9: Meet Windows Azure, 100,000 apps, Windows 8 eBooks, Big Data and more | This Week On Channel 9
item.description:
This week on Channel 9, Dan and Brian discuss the week's top developer news, including:

  • [0:27] Meet the New Windows Azure (Scott Guthrie)
  • [2:26] Announcing New Windows Azure Services to Deliver “Hybrid Cloud” (Bill Laing), Windows Azure SDK for .NET - June 2012
  • [4:14] Windows Phone Marketplace hits 100,000 applications, 313 new apps added daily (Robin Wauters)
  • [5:16] June 4th What’s Happening Around Visual Studio (Jason Zander)
  • [6:25] Setup Improvements for Visual Studio (David Guyer)
  • [8:20] A Community for Storyboard Shapes (Brian Harry)
  • [11:08] Free ebook: Programming Windows 8 Apps with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (First Preview), Updated sample code for Programming Windows, Sixth Edition (Consumer Preview edition) (Devon Musgrave)
  • [12:14] Upgrade Metro App From CP To RC (Shai Raiten), Migrating a Windows 8 Metro Style App from Consumer Preview to Release Preview (Dave Isbitski)
  • [13:05] Building Modern Mobile Web Apps – Reference Implementation
  • [13:57] Analyzing some ‘Big’ Data Using C#, Azure And Apache Hadoop – A Stack Overflow .NET Namespace Popularity Finder, Top 500 MSDN Links from Stack Overflow Posts (Anoop Madhusudanan)

Picks of the Week!

  • Brian's Pick of the Week: [16:01] Programmer Time Translation Table (Anders Abel)
  • Dan's Pick of the Week: [17:08] Project Detroit, BoxingBots and Kinect at TechEd (Brian Peek)

 

Programming Note: Due to TechEd North America there will be no show next week (June 15th). If you're there, make sure you stop by and chat with team...

item.title: Major Nelson's highlights from E3 2012 | E3 2012
item.description: Xbox's Major Nelson talks to us to share what he really loved about E3 this year. Catch up on his favorites and find out what he found to be most exciting.
item.itunes:summary: Xbox's Major Nelson talks to us to share what he really loved about E3 this year. Catch up on his favorites and find out what he found to be most exciting.

item.title: Manual Testing Of Windows 8 Metro Style Applications
item.description:
In this video, Brian Keller will show you how you can use Microsoft Test Manager 2012 - part of the Visual Studio 2012 family of technologies - to test Metro style applications on Windows 8. When testing applications in this manner, Microsoft Test Manager will automatically capture rich diagnostics from the Windows 8 machine. This can include video of the tester interacting with the application, or a new rich action log which gets produced in HTML and shows "tap by tap" what the tester was doing leading up to the bug they encountered, making it easier for a developer to quickly understand the bug that the tester found and - most importantly - to get it fixed.

What You'll Need:

Microsoft Test Manager 2012 (included with the following SKU's of Visual Studio 2012):
- Visual Studio Test Professional 2012
- Visual Studio Premium 2012
- Visual Studio Ultimate 2012

Team Foundation Server:
- Hosted Team Foundation Service (http://www.tfspreview.com)
- On-premises Team Foundation Server 2012 (download the RC here, or here for TFS Express)

Windows 8
- Download the release preview here

Configuration steps:
Setup steps for configuring Microsoft Test Manager and your Windows 8 machine for remote testing.

I hope you will find this testing experience useful as you continue building great applications for Windows 8!

- Brian
item.itunes:summary: In this video, Brian Keller will show you how you can use Microsoft Test Manager 2012 - part of the Visual Studio 2012 family of technologies - to test Metro style applications on Windows 8. When testing applications in this manner, Microsoft Test Manager will automatically capture rich diagnostics from the Windows 8 machine. This can include video of the tester interacting with the application, or a new rich action log which gets produced in HTML and shows "tap by tap" what the tester was doing leading up to the bug they encountered, making it easier for a developer to quickly understand the bug that the tester found and - most importantly - to get it fixed.What You'll Need:Microsoft Test Manager 2012 (included with the following SKU's of Visual Studio 2012):- Visual Studio Test Professional 2012- Visual Studio Premium 2012- Visual Studio Ultimate 2012Team Foundation Server:- Hosted Team Foundation Service (http://www.tfspreview.com)- On-premises Team Foundation Server 2012 (download the RC here, or here for TFS Express)Windows 8- Download the release preview hereConfiguration steps:Setup steps for configuring Microsoft Test Manager and your Windows 8 machine for remote testing.I hope you will find this testing experience useful as you continue building great applications for Windows 8!- Brian

item.title: SmartGlass at E3 2012 | E3 2012
item.description: One of the biggest buzz makers this year was the announcement of Microsoft's SmartGlass. The technology incorporates all 3 screens and looks to revolutionize the way we interact with our movies and games. Check out this hands on demo!
item.itunes:summary: One of the biggest buzz makers this year was the announcement of Microsoft's SmartGlass. The technology incorporates all 3 screens and looks to revolutionize the way we interact with our movies and games. Check out this hands on demo!

item.title: South Park: Trey Parker & Matt Stone talk about "The Stick of Truth" | E3 2012
item.description: Trey Parker and Matt Stone have worked tirelessly to create the best South Park game ever. Check out this interview where they discuss how their latest creation, The Stick of Truth came about.
item.itunes:summary: Trey Parker and Matt Stone have worked tirelessly to create the best South Park game ever. Check out this interview where they discuss how their latest creation, The Stick of Truth came about.

item.title: Visual Studio Toolbox: SlowCheetah | Visual Studio Toolbox
item.description: In this episode, Sayed Hashimi joins us to demonstrate SlowCheetah, a Visual Studio extension that enables you to transform your app.config or any other XML file based on the build configuration—you can have both debug and release versions of your configuration files and swap between them when you run the application. No more changing configuration files at runtime, and no more worrying about if you are really using the right one.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Sayed Hashimi joins us to demonstrate SlowCheetah, a Visual Studio extension that enables you to transform your app.config or any other XML file based on the build configuration—you can have both debug and release versions of your configuration files and swap between them when you run the application. No more changing configuration files at runtime, and no more worrying about if you are really using the right one.
item.dc:creator: Robert Green, Golnaz
item.itunes:author: Robert Green, Golnaz

item.title: GoingNative 9: LINQ for C/C++, Native Rx, Meet Aaron Lahman | C9::GoingNative
item.description:
LINQ is one of those modern technologies missing from the C++ toolbox. By extension, so is Rx (Reactive Extensions), which of course is LINQ at its core... Well, today we're happy to announce that this is no longer the case. Erik Meijer's team is delivering on their promise of a native Rx. It's not available for download yet, but the work is being done and great progress has been made! Rock and roll.

Aaron Lahman is the newest member of Erik Meijer's gang of stellar developers. Erik and team are cranking away at pushing LINQ everywhere. Here, we meet Aaron and geek out about C++ LINQ (it's a modern library... Aaron's not extending the language....) and RxC (that's C as in C (not C++)—why C? Why not RxC++? Does it really matter?...)

Here's a trivial example employing C++ LINQ:

vector<int> some_primes(size_t howMany)
{
       auto xs = from(int_range(0, INT_MAX))
                      .where(is_prime)
                      .take(howMany);
       return xs.to_vector();
             // or: vector<int>(begin(xs), end(xs));
}

Table of Contents:

[00:00] GoingNative(); //Charles flies solo for this episode. Make sure you check out the sessions from Developing Windows 8 Metro style apps with C++ event. This is the only place to learn (deeply) about WRL and C++ + XAML + DX, for example. Herb Sutter's keynote is excellent, of course.

[03:00] Charles interviews software developer Aaron Lahman. Aaron explains (whiteboard and demo included) the work he's doing building a LINQ library for C++ and Reactive Extensions for C. Aaron is great at explaining what he's doing (and why he's doing it). Thank you, Aaron! Go Rx!!

[39:58] ~GoingNative();
item.dc:creator: Charles
item.itunes:author: Charles

item.title: Rowan Miller Demonstrates Entity Framework 5 Using ASP.NET MVC 4 | Web Camps TV
item.description: In this episode, Rowan Miller shows you how to get started using his team's latest release, Entity Framework 5. Using a new ASP.NET MVC 4 project, he creates a database using code, then scaffolds an ASP.NET MVC 4 web site to enter and view data from the database. Using the new Migrations features of EF, he then adds some setup and teardown logic and changes the schema. Near the end, the new spatial data features of EF5 are used to demonstrate a geographical search feature, wherein he sorts a series of records in the database according to their proximity to his office. These new spatial features alone make this an exciting episode. Come check out EF5 and see how to use it in your ASP.NET MVC 4 applications today.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Rowan Miller shows you how to get started using his team's latest release, Entity Framework 5. Using a new ASP.NET MVC 4 project, he creates a database using code, then scaffolds an ASP.NET MVC 4 web site to enter and view data from the database. Using the new Migrations features of EF, he then adds some setup and teardown logic and changes the schema. Near the end, the new spatial data features of EF5 are used to demonstrate a geographical search feature, wherein he sorts a series of records in the database according to their proximity to his office. These new spatial features alone make this an exciting episode. Come check out EF5 and see how to use it in your ASP.NET MVC 4 applications today.

item.title: Casablanca | Developing Windows 8 Metro style apps with C++
item.description:
Casablanca is an incubation project available on MSDN DevLabs. Its primary purpose is to explore how to access and author REST services in modern C++ using best practices such as asynchronous operations to achieve responsiveness in clients and scalability in service code.

[This session was pre-recorded]
item.itunes:summary: Casablanca is an incubation project available on MSDN DevLabs. Its primary purpose is to explore how to access and author REST services in modern C++ using best practices such as asynchronous operations to achieve responsiveness in clients and scalability in service code.[This session was pre-recorded]

item.title: TechEd Quick Shot - Mark Russinovich
item.description:
TechEd attendees (in both North America and Europe) are in for a treat. Mark Russinovich is a rock star when it comes to digging into the internal workings of the system. His talks are always well attended, and rich with deep technical information. At TechEd this year he will be doing several great sessions that will focus on Windows Azure, Security, and Windows Internals.

  • Mark's TechEd North America Sessions
  • Mark's TechEd Europe Sessions

item.title: TWC9: Windows 8 Release Preview, Visual Studio 2012 RC, Storyboards, HTML5 and more | This Week On Channel 9
item.description:
This week on Channel 9, Clint and Rick discuss the week's top developer news, including:

  • [0:27] Windows 8 Release Preview
  • [1:28] Visual Studio 2012 Release Candidate is here
  • [3:04] Welcome to the Developer Tools Blog Network (Lisa Feigenbaum)
  • [4:59] My Favorite Features: Creating Storyboards with PowerPoint (Jason Zander)
  • [6:29] Being productive in the background – background tasks (Hari Pulapaka)
  • [8:29] Getting Started on Line-of-Business HTML5 App – Part 4 Using Modernizr, Polyfills, YepNope (Bruce Kyle)
  • [10:41] Howard Dierking Shows You How to Optimize Your ASP.NET Sites (Brady Gaster, Howard Dierking)

Picks of the Week!

  • Rick's Pick of the Week: [11:20] Fun with HTML5 Canvas, WebSocket, JQuery and ASP.NET. End-result: A live white board on a web page! (Al-Farooque Shubho)
  • Clint's Pick of the Week: [12:47] Occlusion detection and virtual object manipulation with the Kinect

item.title: Porting a desktop app to a Metro style app | Developing Windows 8 Metro style apps with C++
item.description: What does it take to port a desktop app to Metro? Learn about the common issues when porting and techniques to help address them.
item.itunes:summary: What does it take to port a desktop app to Metro? Learn about the common issues when porting and techniques to help address them.
item.dc:creator: Sridhar Madhugiri
item.itunes:author: Sridhar Madhugiri

item.title: C++ and DirectX for Metro Style Games | Developing Windows 8 Metro style apps with C++
item.description: DirectX, the most popular 3-D game API, is directly accessible by Windows 8 metro-style applications in C++. If you have a C++/Direct3D codebase, or want to create a 3-D game, this talk will show you how to use C++ and DirectX to build metro-style apps. You will also learn about new Windows 8 metro features like process lifetime management, CoreWindow, asynchronous execution, live tiles, and display rotation, and the latest 'best practices' for their use from the perspective of C++/DirectX game development.
item.itunes:summary: DirectX, the most popular 3-D game API, is directly accessible by Windows 8 metro-style applications in C++. If you have a C++/Direct3D codebase, or want to create a 3-D game, this talk will show you how to use C++ and DirectX to build metro-style apps. You will also learn about new Windows 8 metro features like process lifetime management, CoreWindow, asynchronous execution, live tiles, and display rotation, and the latest 'best practices' for their use from the perspective of C++/DirectX game development.
item.dc:creator: Chas Boyd, Matt Sandy
item.itunes:author: Chas Boyd, Matt Sandy

item.title: Async made simple with C++ PPL | Developing Windows 8 Metro style apps with C++
item.description: The new Windows Runtime is adopting a heavily asynchronous programming model to ensure the responsiveness of Windows 8 client apps. This makes it more critical than ever to have great support for asynchronous programming in C++. Learn about the PPL async library innovations and how these features come together with new Windows Runtime APIs to simplify asynchronous programming.
item.itunes:summary: The new Windows Runtime is adopting a heavily asynchronous programming model to ensure the responsiveness of Windows 8 client apps. This makes it more critical than ever to have great support for asynchronous programming in C++. Learn about the PPL async library innovations and how these features come together with new Windows Runtime APIs to simplify asynchronous programming.
item.dc:creator: Rahul V. Patil, Genevieve Fernandes
